title: Ticket #3017: Parallel Universe jobs with ParallelSchedulingGroups can stay idle
description:
Parallel universe jobs that specify they want parallel scheduling groups can stay idle when there are available machines in a group they could match to. This is because of the two phase matching in the dedicated scheduling. When PSG is on, the job is tentatively matched in the schedd, and if a match is found, the dedicated scheduler asks the negotiator for machines. However, it does not ask for any particular machines, so the machines given out by the matchmaker may be from arbitrary parallel scheduling groups.

To fix this, when the dedicated scheduler matches to a particular parallel scheduling group, it will amend the requirements of that match to add in the PSG, so that the negotiator will be forced to give it machines from that group.
remarks:
2012-Oct-26 08:52:59 by samf:
Not fixed yet. I managed to submit jobs with Parallel Scheduling Groups (PSGs) that remain idle. 

#############################################
##   submit description file for a parallel program
#############################################
universe = parallel
executable = /bin/sleep
getenv=true
arguments = 60

should_transfer_files = yes
when_to_transfer_output = on_exit_or_evict

output = o.$(NODE)
error  = e.$(NODE)
log    = l

notification = never
machine_count = 2
+WantParallelSchedulingGroups = True

initialdir = job.$(Process)
queue 8

Yet, if I run the same code but change 

queue 8

to 

queue

and manually submit the otherwise identical code on the command line 8 times, the jobs do not become idle.

Additionally, it looks like PSGs may need to have a condor restart instead of doing a condor_reconfig in order to have PSGs initialize (at least on a slot-by-slot basis).

2012-Nov-12 17:45:38 by samf:
So it looks like the code does what it's supposed to do. But the manual does not describe what the code does. I'm working on writing some text to update the manual.

2013-May-24 16:23:59 by samf:
I've updated the documentation about the queue command in condor_submit. It's in the V8_0_0-branch. See Ticket #3339 for where the commits are.
